vulnerabilities.name: Gateway Exposure - No Auth
vulnerabilities.description: Default localhost trust treats proxied external traffic as local, bypassing security if trustedProxies isn't set

vulnerabilities.name: TrustedProxies Misconfiguration
vulnerabilities.description: Empty or overly permissive trustedProxies allows external traffic to be treated as local

vulnerabilities.name: Auth Bypass - No Token
vulnerabilities.description: Gateway running without authentication allows anyone with network access to send commands
vulnerabilities.mitigation: Set gateway.auth.mode: 'token' with a strong token

vulnerabilities.name: Prompt Injection via External Content
vulnerabilities.description: Malicious inputs in fetched web content or messages can trick AI into unauthorized actions
vulnerabilities.mitigation: Content filtering, sandboxed execution, human approval for sensitive actions

vulnerabilities.name: API Key Exfiltration
vulnerabilities.description: Attempts to read and transmit API keys, tokens, or credentials to external services
vulnerabilities.mitigation: Block outbound requests containing credential patterns

vulnerabilities.name: Human Approval Bypass
vulnerabilities.description: Trust model vulnerability - 'human clicked OK' != 'human understood what they were approving'
vulnerabilities.affected: All AI agent systems with approval flows
vulnerabilities.mitigation: Clear approval prompts, cooling-off periods for sensitive actions

scam_accounts.description: Fake account promoting $MLBT Solana token, impersonating OpenClaw
scam_accounts.warning: Official project stated: 'there isn't and is never going to be any token'
